alert.note: Alert for Estill; Jackson; Lee; Montgomery; Owsley; Powell; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 5:16AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Powell, southern Montgomery, western Owsley, Estill, northwestern Jackson, western Lee and southwestern Wolfe Counties through 600 AM EDT... At 515 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Wades Mill to 6 miles north of Richmond. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Harris Ferry around 520 AM EDT. Camargo and Levee around 525 AM EDT. Clay City, Virden, Waltersville, Powell Valley, Westbend, Winston, Bean and Cressy around 530 AM EDT. Stanton, Vaughns Mill, Blackburn, Spout Springs, Kimbrell, Kings Station, Witt, Hargett and Rice Station around 535 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Knowlton, Locust Branch, Shirley, Cottage Furnace, Rosslyn, Cat Creek, Hardwick, Jinks, Bowen, Lombard, Ravenna, Furnace, Hisel, Fitchburg, Brazil, Alcorn, Kerby Knob, Rogers Chapel, Pitts, Blanton Flats, Patsey, Waneta, Cobhill, See, Sandgap, Foxtown, Collingsworth, Pilot, Standing Rock, Eglon, McKee, Greeley, Whynot, Hurley, Bradshaw, Macedonia, Old Landing, Fixer, Crystal and Pinnacle. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 13 and 43. Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 105 and 108. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Estill; Jackson; Lee; Montgomery; Owsley; Powell; Wolfe
